Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great staff, poor accomodation”
Reviews.Author: FlowaPowa
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel for its location and friendly staff, however the accomodation standards are poor. If you are visiting London for a couple of days, are on a budget and don't mind hostel-type accomodation and don't intend to spend much time in the hotel, it will be fine. Pros: 1. Close to Gloucester Road tube station, Picadilly and Circle Lines. Only one tube ride home from West End. 2. Located in Kensington, a very safe area 3. Can use the kitchen facilities including microwave, kettle etc (expect when breakfast is being prepared by the staff) 4. Exceptionally friendly and attentive staff 5. Very cheap for the area! 6. My daughter and I were upgraded from a double to a triple room at no extra cost. 7. The other travellers we met were all very friendly. Cons: 1. The room smelt damp 2. The single bed was so lumpy that my daughter and I shared the double bed. This was our original plan as we had only booked a double room so we weren't upset by this. 3. The room desperately needed a refurb - the toilet cistern lid was broken; the wooden veneer on the tv stand/cupboard was warped stood a couple of inches above the the top it was supposed to be attached to; and although the bathroom was clean, it had black mould growing in the corners. 4.There was no hot water in the mornings for a shower. Evenings seemed to be OK. 5. One of the plug sockets didn't work. 6. The curtains were too small for the window.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Virginia C Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the money. Very difficult to sleep with lift noise going all night. If I used it again I would certainly request a room as far from the lift as possible. Breakfast was a disappointment - fruit juice turned out to be squash and the service was pleasant without being cheery. No top-ups on tea, coffee or toast offered. Bonus was proximity to Gloucester Rd tube and hotel set in lovely, quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: emmauk86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a twin room with my mum for one night. This was in a great location not far from Gloucester Road tube station (a 5 min walk maximum) and it felt a safe place to be. The hotel is converted old house and some of the original features remain which make it a beautiful building. We stayed in an attic room which was basic but fine for one evening. We opted for a room with a bath and despite the low ceiling (owing to it being in the eaves of the building) was a good bathroom with a lovely deep bath. Breakfast was brilliant, we had a full english, then were offered a range of fruits, bread and pastries. It was basic food but lots of it and was perfect for setting us up for a day's shopping!! We went through a late deals website and got the room for about £75, which considering a chain hotel round the corners best offer was about £125, and that it was only 10 days before christmas was an excellent bargain. They offered us the chance to keep our bags for the day for free, but we decided to leave them at Kings Cross instead as it meant less travel, but another excellent service on offer. They provided towels, which were only small but met need, take your own if you want bigger and your own toiletries. Would definately visit again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Camilla B
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in an excellent location, and we had a fantastic overnight stay here. On arrival we were greeted at the check in and offered toiletries if required and told we can help ourselves to hot drinks and juice from dining room and a wide variety of fruit was also available. The room was clean and of a style you would expect for the price, we had an ensuite with a double and 2 singles. In the morning we had breakfast which definately provided enough food to start the day. There was plenty on offer and on checking out we were able to leave our luggage at the hotel until we were ready to travel home. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout our stay. It is a great place to crash for the night on a budget and we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “insane”
Reviews.Author: Sylvia030
Reviews.Content: this is the worst place I've ever seen in my travel around the world. Beijing 35 years ago was luxury, compared to this hotel. Dirty, smelly, uncomfortable, badly or not heated at all, drafty windows.the room is illuminated the whole night from the light outside in the corridor. Not to speak about the noise from the neighbours, their TV (lucky if it works), the slamming of doors on the upper and lower floors. No toilet paper (this must be collected on a table close to the hotel reception), no soap, old and worn-out beds, lousy pillows, no chairs to put your clothes, no space to turn around. A gloomy-faced Director. Fortunately his staff is trying to make up for all this by being friendly, but the hotel is still not up to any standard and should just be closed up and removed from the lists. A real pity, as the area is very stylish, beautiful streets and parks around and the tube close by.

Reviews.Title: “good value, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: claeale
Reviews.Content: This hotel is suitable for those who doesn'it have excessive demands, but wants a clean room, a good and kind staff, and breakfast included (not amazing, but enaugh in comparizon with how much paid). Centrally located, we slept in a quaintupla on 2nd floor, spacious, comfortable. Good value, very good quality /price ratio. Absolutely to book!

Reviews.Title: “St Simeon hotel Harrington Gardens”
Reviews.Author: kerry m
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at, DO NOT STAY HERE! The building was very old and tired inside and our room smelt damp and the windows were very drafty with the beds underneath them! When we arrrived our key wasnt available for several hours so we had to ask the owner to let us into our room. Breakfast was very cramped, the service was terrible and the food not much better with chipped milk jugs,dirty table cloths and crumbs in the rancid butter. Please take note of this review, you wont want to stay in this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: BMorris2011
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel that I have ever stayed at. My wife and I booked and prepaid for a four night stay. Once booked in though you can not get any of your money back if you want to leave early so beware.. The room was deplorable: dirty, cramped (7 ft.wide). The bathroom was barely functional. This hotel reminds me of old Soviet Union accomodations. Noisy all night with doors slaming, loud voices, creaking floors, and walls so thin you can hear your neighbours doing their business during the night. The doors don't even have door handles. No soap or shampoo unless you make a special request. At breakfast you must sit where you are told and are provided and as a reward are offered copious amounts of fruit that is in various stages of decay. I can't think of a single good thing to say about this except that we made it out alive and it is an experience we will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Old, noisy, not recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Dawnie22
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights with my husband, 2 young daughters and my mother-in-law. We had a family room, which actually sleeps 7. The layout of the room was very accommodating, with 2 single beds and bunk beds on the main level. Then you go up stairs to a loft with a single bed and a double bed. The bathroom was very old and in desperate need of updating. The toilet wouldn't flush without effort. The sink's faucets were way too close to the back of the sink, making if very difficult to wash your hands. The location has a lot of street noise with vehicles going nonstop all night. You have to open the balcony doors for ventilation (no air conditioning). Yes, there is a balcony, but you share it with the room next door. You have to make sure the balcony doors are locked before you leave the room for security. And they were hard to open and close! Breakfast was included and served downstairs. We only ate there once, as that was more than enough! They had tons of fruit, but there were flies around it! And the father of the family keep pushing the fruit on us. Very annoying! This hotel is family run and they do try hard, but the building desperately needs updates and renovations. When we went to check in, our room wasn't ready yet. They stowed our luggage in the dining area and we went off to explore London. It was obvious they rushed getting our room ready because when we got back a few hours later, our sheets were still damp! I turned down the bed and we went to dinner. By the time we got back, they were dry, but that unnerved me. While I could see the effort being made here, I don't recommend this hotel unless they go through a major renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Posh neigbourhood, nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grania-04
Reviews.Content: Because of several reasons I had to leave the flat of a friend one day before my train went back to Paris. An agency at Victoria Coach Station found St. Simeon for that one missing night and for me it was okay. As it was on very short term I paid almost 30 pounds for a bed in a mixed shared room with three men and one woman. It would be too much for a "normal" booking in reasonable time but I read their regular prices on the website and I think they are okay and I would return to that hotel for my next holidays in London. The neighbourhood is very posh with several luxury hotels nearby. The hotel itself is in a house close to a garden and only two minutes from tube station Gloucester Road away. Near the station there are some fast food restaurants and bars and a small super-market. Some negative reviews (like dusty/small/shabby) may be right, however I did not have problems with that. I am not made out of sugar and dust has never killed anyone (and I have seen worse). Other reviews complained that the linen were dirty, but my bed was totally okay . The bedcover with floral print was old and worn out, as seemed all bedcovers, but not dirty. The staff was friendly and the fully English breakfast with fruits very good. I would recommend that hotel to travellers who need the hotel as a place to sleep and who can acknowledge the difference between a sterile chain hotel as can be found in every bigger city and a hotel run by a family and with a soul like St. Simeon. PS: When you enter the hotel look at the wall on the right side in the hallway and read the inscription underneath the statue! I think it can tell you more about St. Simeon and its owners than any review.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: redsoxnut555
Reviews.Content: A very no frills budget hotel in a very posh neighborhood. The hotel is only a stones throw from a Millenium Hotel and a Waldorf Astoria Hotel, so you know your in good company. We stayed in the room that fit 5 and had 4 people for most of the trip. Our room had 1 double bed and 3 singles (twins). The beds were very college dorm esque, which I am not saying is a bad thing. Just letting you know. The hotel and room were very clean. We stayed on the 4th floor and the room seemed to get warm with the windows closed so we always kept one open a little. Very convient location to the Gloucester Road tube. Its about a 4-5 min walk from tube to hotel. Very safe neighborhood. I walked it all different hours of the day and night and never felt scared. The kitchen closes at 9 yet the staff came in and out of it all the time. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who just wants a place to rest their head at night and is looking for no frills. If they offer to haggle taxi prices for you, do not do it or entertain it. Just walk one block up to the Millenium where there is a taxi rank and get one of those.

Reviews.Title: “This little hotel is in a great location and the staff were kind and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Londontrip2011
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with a degree of trepidation because of the very mixed reviews I had read, but I was interested in its position relative to the Natural History Museum as we had a baby and a 4 year old. I found it to be excellent, If you are looking for the hotel to be part of a luxury break don't go here, but if you just need somewhere convenient and reasonably cheap to rest and sleep, this little hotel is absolutely fine. The staff were kindness personified, the owner appears to be very keen that his guests eat their 5 a day in the form of fruit, which is not a bad thing! It is true the rooms were smallish, but they were completely clean and quiet for London. We had our own bathroom, and there is a lift. Towels were changed daily. The telly was small and old, but we didn't actually go to London to watch telly... All in all I found it very refreshing not to be staying in a boring old chain hotel. This hotel has its foibles, but it is absolutely fine. The only minus was that there was no tea making facility in the room, but you could actually go downstairs to the kitchen to make a pot. Other reviewers have said the owner/boss was difficult, but he was polite and helpful to us, as were all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “extremely helpful”
Reviews.Author: calkez
Reviews.Content: we came across this hotel after cancelling a previous dirty one, we found the hotel staff extremely helpful in all aspects of our visit, this hotel is a budget hotel but very clean and we always left in the morning with full bellys

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a room with our 3 children. We were pleased when we saw the room with a double and a single on one floor and 3 singles on a large mezzanine. Loads of food at breakfast time and whilst we found it an unusual experience, we enjoyed it and were set for the day with full bellies. If you are only used to sterile, commoditised chain hotels then you might be out of your comfort zone. If more open minded then you have a good value base to explore London from. By the way, for those with kids, London's excellent museums are within walking distance and they are free!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: hannar52
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as I was attending a concert at the Royal Albert Hall and was looking for somewhere cheap to lay my head for he night. Originally I was supposed to be staying there with a friend but she had to cancel the the last minute however if she had stayed we would have only paid £34.50 each for the night in a hotel in Kensington, inc full breakkfast - not bad! The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful and made me feel very welcome. The room, although a long way from the Ritz was adequate, clean and tidy. It was basic, but I didn't have any higher expectations for the price, The location was excellent, being close to Gloucester Rd tube and also a 10 minute walk from teh Albert Hall/Hyde Park. Many musuems are also close by. There were a few random items of furniture dotted around the building and it was a bit rickety however having read some of the reviews on here I thought it was going to be much worse. I felt compelled to write a review because I feel some of the reviews on here are unfair and if you are looking for somewhere cheap and clean in this area of London, I would recommend here - just don't expect anything special in terms of decor/furniture and you won't be dissapointed. The staff, location and price more than make up for it's shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “For the price and location, this hotel is a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Beenthere
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in Saint Simeon Hotel for four nights. This is a small hotel run by a family. We found everyone from the receptionist, chef, kitchen helpers and the owner to be very accommodating, generous and warm. The location is only 10 minutes from the Gloucester Road tube station and also a bus stop is close by. From the tube station you walk along the main road with shops, restaurants, money exchange bureaus. Harrington Garden Street is lined up with apartments and trees, which really makes it homey. When we checked in, they showed us two rooms but we took the one on the 4th floor; one (1) twin and one (1) single. The rooms are clean and so is the bathroom. It's adequate for two people. The hotel has an elevator which is really a plus. The breakfast room is in the basement. Everyday they offer full hot breakfast consisting of egg, sausage, ham and beans. In addition, there is an assortment of breads, jams and plenty of fruits to choose from. The owner personally go to each guest and offer plates of fruits. Although we observed that the kitchen is not well kept. In the afternoon, there are still dishes, pots and pans stacked up waiting to be washed. The dining area is wifi'ed for those who bring their own laptop. I would recommend this hotel to someone (friend) who's looking for a good accommodation and customer service without the hefty price.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: CockneyBrum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it was cheapish for London and it was close to the Royal Albert Hall (about a 15 minute walk) for a concert we were attending. The nearest tube is Gloucester Road, which is about a 10 minute walk away. It cost us around £60 with a bit less for cashback via a hotel broker website. The staff were friendly when we arrived and left. There is a £3 cash deposit payable on arrival for your room key. The breakfast was great and the food just kept on coming, with fruit and a full 'English' included in the price. This was about the best aspect of the hotel. Now to the room. This was a bit grotty, TINY but clean. We had seperate beds, despite asking for a double. If you just have a small overnight bag you will be fine but anything larger, forget it. We had to ask for shower gel and soap. They were not in the room upon arrival. The rubbish bin in the bathroom/shower was actually an old catering bucket and the floor towel looks like it was taken from a hotel in the far east! (not that this is a deal breaker). As others have said, the walls and windows are thin. You could hear people shouting in the street or flats outside until the early hours. The worst bit was that the room had curtains which barely went across the window (see my photos), so it let the street lighting into the room. I would imagine the room would be quite cold in the winter. There is a clapped out old 'Saisho' TV to keep you entertained. I haven't seen this model in about 20 years! The surrounding neighbourhood felt safe and vibrant with a good range of bars and restaurants. We had dinner in a nearby upmarket hamburger restaurant (Byron) which is opposite the tube station and comes highly recommended. Cost about £30 for both of us with hamburgers, wine & beer and a couple of side dishes. They were still open at 11pm on a Friday night, which was impressive. Only book here if needs really must and you're not too fussed on getting a totally good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Totally budget”
Reviews.Author: TravellerMonkey6
Reviews.Content: It's cheap but not very cheerful. If all you want is a bed for the night then it's a good choice. We stayed in a double room and there was enough room for the bed and a wardrobe squashed by the window and a very small bathroom by the door; but if you're not looking for a luxurious break away then it will definitely suit your needs. It was clean and the staff were helpful although breakfast was more than a little hectic. Breakfast comes included in the price but I'd go elsewhere for food in the morning because the hotel is holds more guests than the dining room can handle so it gets very busy and very noisy but there is plenty of food available. And a word of warning, the walls are paper thin! There was a group of 3 next door who stayed up talking (at a normal noise level, not loud) until 4am and you could hear every word, but that's no fault to the staff. I'd recommend for a one night stay but look elsewhere if a holiday is what you're looking for.

Reviews.Title: “SO WONDERFUL! SAFE, CALM, RELAXING!!!`”
Reviews.Author: cicimayer
Reviews.Content: I just flew into London yesterday and made the mistake of not booking my housing in advance. I just checked out and I'm still here using the internet and sitting in the dinning area. EVERYONE here was friendly and even though I booked a shared room with 5 beds, I was the only one staying in it! So I lucked out and had the room to myself. Located in a LOVELY neighborhood just 3 blocks from the train station, my 2 story room had a charming blacony and was spacious even with 5 beds in it! If I were staying in London longer, I would continue to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE , WORST HOTEL , DIRTY AND VERY UNPLEASENT STAY”
Reviews.Author: jorichards
Reviews.Content: I wanted to leAve feedback on this hotel as it is possably the worst hotel i have stayed in .The hotel from outside look great , old london town house but once inside it is grime , cluttered and dirty in appearance. The room are even worst , very basic with poor furniture with dirty bedding , crecky bed , damp towels , no hot tap working at the sink , 20 year old TV and not a proper lock on the door . It was noisy as can hear all guest coming and going and telephone in reception ringing . Breakfast was even worst , several plates of fruit had been left on a table all night and was rotting, The cutlery was dirty and tables not clean , also plates of ham and cheese covered in cellophane were left on a table in the hot room. I got told off for sitting on a table set up for 4 people hence i had a coffee and left .All in All this hotel was disgusting and recommend you do not stay here .

Reviews.Title: “Count the Lamborghinis”
Reviews.Author: Lindsabelle
Reviews.Content: St. Simeon was a great BUDGET hotel! Clean place to lay your head is my standard. It was a little musty and old, but clean and the staff was kind and helpful. Someone told us not to expect much from our lodging in London because most London hotels are crazy expensive in July and kind of a let down, but I was satisfied. We had a 4 (5) person room on the 3rd floor. It was clean and cheap, what more could you want? Cheaper than a hostel for the four of us and a WAY better breakfast. I personally loved the weird boot sale decor and odd owner that pushed us to eat fruit in the mornings (kinda like my Grandpa). And the location was fantastic - close to an underground and Sansbury’s (a supermarket). It is in a nice neighborhood too - it was fun to count the Lamborghinis, Ferraris, and Maseratis on the streets. Seriously, awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: stacey81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in a quad room with my three teenagers. We were in the process of moving and had a lot of big, heavy luggage. The staff were very accommodating, switching us to a bigger room and helping move the bags both when we arrived and left. The room itself was clean and comfortable and the teenagers were thrilled with the free wireless. The location in Kensington was great. So to get all that at the price we paid, I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Good and cheap”
Reviews.Author: BurgerQueenWien
Reviews.Content: Reception was very welcoming and friendly. We had a room on the top floor (fifth) under the roof. The room was lovely, the bathroom tiny but impeccably clean as was the entire room. The hotel has its flair, breakfast was very nice and the waiting staff kept offering fresh fruit, cheese, more coffee - we liked it a lot! Water pressure in this old building wasn´t too strong - but if you´re patient you´ll manage to shower and get the shampoo out of the hair. The walls are very thin, and if your neighbours are three adult males after a few beers, talking late into the night, you´ll unwillingly understand every stupid word they say (but inconsiderate behaviour of your fellow travellers isn´t the hotel´s fault). The situation is perfect, staff very helpful, rooms are clean - we´d definitely recommend this hotel and we´ll return :-)

Reviews.Title: “Thankyou for a pleasant stay at your hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bettyc3max
Reviews.Content: We are four Scottish" Lassies" who have just enjoyed our visit to this hotel. We felt welcome from the very start. The quad room was located in the basement which had two windows looking into the cobbled Mews at the rear of the Hotel. The room was clean with very comfortable beds (one double and two single) which had lovely fresh sheets and nice clean duvet covers. The toilet was quite small but adequate for the purpose. The staff were very pleasant. The breakfast in the morning was very good with full English breakfast (really nice sausages) with toast and bread and delicious home made jam. Then there was Johnny, quite a character plying us with croissants and fruit . There was plenty of fruit which was available night and day. The kitchen was available for anyone to use at any time. A great experience and would recommend this hotel. Will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “A Horrible, Dirty Hotel, Do not stay here, you have been warned.”
Reviews.Author: julian_blackwell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in London and this has got to be the worse ever. I booked a triple, i.e. 3 separate beds, for 3 people. On arrival for our first night we were allocated the only room left, a basement room which was next to the breakfast and dinning area. The room was dirty, smelt of food, cold and the sheets were itchy and it had no window. It had 3 beds. In the morning we were woken at 5.30am by the staff preparing breakfast. The remaining 2 nights were moved to another room with a double and a single bed and informed that there were no other rooms which held 3 beds, (which is what we had originally booked and paid for. ) We were informed if we didn't like it, the other option was the other room back down to the basement! We move to the other room and stayed there for the remaining 2 days. It was also filthy, cold and did not have 3 beds as we had booked. Breakfast was appalling, they had fruit laid out everywhere on plates, I am not sure how long it had been there but it was very unhygienic. I am going to contact the Food Standards Agency and HSE. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Fawly Towers could have been the Ritz compared to this”
Reviews.Author: madsv
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to nights with my brother from the 4th to the 6th, well we left the 5th because we would rather be out in the cold than stay in this socalled hotel. The location is good, yes but then everything stops. The hotel is extremely dirty. I have seen high way public toilets more cleaner than this. It smells, the rooms are extremely tinny, that it is almost a bad joke, which you unfortunately have paid for. Rooms are also very very cold, we could see our breath and on the linnen there were traces of blood. Extremely discusting. I would NEVER recommend any to stay here. There are so many other good places in London but this one should be avoided by all means. I just checked my netbank this morning and saw a transaction for 45 GBP from another hotel in London after the 90 GBP from this were paid. The strange thing is that I only used that credit card only once when I was in London. I have asked my bank to take a look at it, but I am very worried they have compied my card.

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty Hotel - Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: MilanoMike
Reviews.Content: We would NOT recommend this hotel at all. Our rooms was very dirty and small. Beds were small and dirty too. We have had never been in such a bad hotel. Please stay away from this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and friendly place, close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: Unicornsherry
Reviews.Content: While this hotel would not stand a "white glove test" it is a comfortable place to stay. It was just what I wanted, something with a "lived in feel" and a place with character. The family who run it are friendly and try to make sure you have everything you need. The rooms are small, but I expected that, and the beds are comfortable. Traveling with 3 adult sons, being able to use the kitchen was a plus, as we could make sandwiches in there and save a bit on food. Breakfast, while not fancy, was plentiful, and the older gentleman was always bringing around the coffee, tea, or fruit. It is a quick walk to the Gloucester station. Wi-fi is free, and accessable from the lobby, the dining room, or the 1st and 2nd floor landings.

Reviews.Title: “Grottiest hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: fabinico
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and the neighbourhood rather nice, the problems start once you enter the hotel. Being three with a baby, we were given a quadruple in the basement. Yes, in the basement ! Technically speaking, there was a window, looking over a wall three feet away. The rooms were terribly dirty, especially the blankets and the bathroom. Luckily we were able to bathe most of the times at friends' place. During our three night stay, the room wasn't cleaned once. We were next to the kitchens, appallingly disgusting, and with noise from 6 a.m. On the upside, the staff were friendly and helpful, there were fruit, tea and coffee freely available, but frankly it cannot compensate for the terrible experience we had to live. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Toxic breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Varsovian
Reviews.Content: Oh my God! I didn't know whether to laugh or cry - this group of buffoons should not have a hotel to run. The price was excellent. Like for a rusty, second-hand Ford Mondeo. The location could not be better - right by the museums. That's what my kids wanted - the Science Museum especially. Anyway, I digress. Room: we had a room for 4, so we expected to be a bit squashed. I loved the room door - very studenty. The bed linen was washed by someone who needs to learn how to operate a washing machine. I mean, was it too much powder or too little, or just poor quality? Whatever it was, they were greyish. Yuk. The carpet was sticky ... double-yuk. Amazingly, we had our own fridge in the room - vital for us because we had some very expensive medicine we needed to keep cool. Less amazingly, it didn't work. The upshot of this was I got to know the owner a little and the kitchen more than I really wanted to. The owner was a charming old Serb who thought I was wrong about the fridge not working, but didn't see fit to prove me wrong. He promised to change my fridge, but one of his workers told me not to expect anything, as he's very forgetful. So, I stored the medicine in the kitchen fridge (there was a common fridge in the "breakfast" room). A bit of a GBP 3,000 risk, but I had no choice. The fridge was clean and the food was separated properly. The rest of the kitchen was splattered in bacon fat. Morning came - we felt good - quality mattresses. Truly. I noticed another mattress stored above the toilet annex. Bizarre. There was also various detritus scattered around the hotel - old furniture and broken office chairs on display. Breakfast - at this point I feel like the Commissioner in the Clouseau films, you know, giggling insanely. Dingey breakfast room, people crammed in. Bacon fat smoke smarting your eyes. Poor quality bacon - the cheapest stuff. Matched the baked beans. Service given by a char lady wearing the dirtiest apron possible. Ahh - the tea. OMG, I just loved that great big pot she poured from. Shame it dripped so much over every single table!! Toast. It was astonishing how they burnt every single slice - you can't fault them for thoroughness! Jam - no choice of single servings in plastic or the alternative of quality produce you sometimes get. Here it was cost-cutting par excellence. I fell into conversation with a middle-aged French couple sat cheek by jowl with me. Restaurant owners!! I could have cried. My wife did (because of the smoke). One good thing is that you have access to the kitchen daytime - so you can have tea and sandwiches ... and make yourself some unburnt toast as well. As for parking - I saved a fortune by ditching the car on Putney Heath (after dropping off the family) and taking the Underground. To sum up - you can survive sleeping in this place, but please get breakfast somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “OK, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: skywalker047
Reviews.Content: Stayed at St Simeon on recommendation of some friends who go there regularly. Its cheap - booked a triple room which worked out at £75 per night. For a hotel in Kensington, near to tube station, in good location this seemed a real bargain. The beds were clean, the room was small but adequate, the shower worked. The breakfast was basically what had been on offer at Sainsbury's the night before! But if you aren't expecting luxury this was fine - we had fruit, plenty of toast, hot drinks. It was a bit like a cross between a hotel and a youth hostel as we were offered access to the kitchen to prepare meals and drinks up to 9pm. I would book it again as there were no real problems and I've stayed in more expensive hotels and not had much better facilties.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place in Kensington, London”
Reviews.Author: Mica02
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 lovely days in this hotel with a friend of mine. It is located in a perfect location andvery close to the undeground station. Room & bathroom were very clean, bed comftarble and the staff was really nice and friendly. I will definetly go back to this hotel next time i will visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: traveller_itch
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through the Victoria Station travel assistance center only because it was the cheapest available on the day itself (a Saturday). The location was excellent, a rather upscale neighborhood, and I thought I stumbled on a hidden gem. But when I saw my room, I was horrified. It was thoroughly disgusting--dirty and smelled like feet. The bathroom was slimy, the bed was deformed and worn out, and the sheets were itchy. Good thing I paid only for the night. I checked out early the next morning, after a rather unappetizing breakfast of oily stuff.

Reviews.Title: “St. Simeon's is worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: ErjaPekka
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very pleasant experience. For a budget hotel it is clean, situated in a relatively quiet neighbohood, is near great sightings and also very near major subway lines. Breakfast is something you either like or don't like, but no one forces you to eat it. Staff was excellent, most of them very friendly, also the breakfast room personnel. Put together, one of my best experiences with budget hotels. Shower and loo worked excellently, no foreign insects near us, view to a relatively quiet street and no gutters as in one of British hotel I've stayed in... If I must say one negative thing, that is that our room was on 3rd floor and for middle aged couple that was a bit challenge:-) All in all, very positive experience! -erja

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: mitch42
Reviews.Content: I came here because my friend told me about great hospitality. Rooms are nice and people who work there the most generous.i ate so much and laughed with them. This hotel is mostly for people who like to feel like at home. Mitch

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, great location, realistic expectation”
Reviews.Author: mamamaria58
Reviews.Content: A rather belated review of our stay at St Simeons. Booked online but ensured accuracy by emailing and also phoning. Unfortunately they tend to employ Eastern Europeans with limited english so sometimes difficult to make yourself understood. We travelled as a family of five and my husband uses a wheelchair. We walked everywhere to museums etc and only needed to use a taxi once when returning from a west end show. Location is very convenient. Close to all transport, supermarkets, laundromat and internet cafe. Staff helpful. Room had a mezzanine with one double bed and 4 singles, therefore room was reasonably cramped. For extra five pounds a night we had a small camping fridge and colour TV. Sheets etc a little thin but clean linen every day. Bathroom was a bath with a shower over the top and a toilet. For a family you had to wait your turn. Had to keep chasing up extra towels if they forgot. Breakfast quite adequate ie ham, eggs, beans, toast, sausages etc. No cereals. Diluted cordial for fruit juice. Plenty of tea and weak hot chocolate. Admittedly fruit was often not quality but amount plentiful. Able to use kitchen to prepare meals so this was quite useful. All in all very cheap for London and for a family from Oz

Reviews.Title: “DON'T GO, PREFER TO SLEEP UNDER A BRIDGE, IT'S BETTER”
Reviews.Author: gnappy_78
Reviews.Content: Please, if you care about your health don't go!I arrived and it took 30 min to do the check in. The guys at the reception try to approach me in all the possible ways, not professional at all but still acceptable. I took one en suite room, the carpet was dirty and disgusting as well as the duvets (full of hairs and other unkown things). I noticed the pillow cases were full of red spots, I understood later the reason for that: once you turn off the lights a lot of small and big insects will climb your bed and suck your blood. If you kill them they will leave a blood spot (which is your blood!!!) on the bed: that's the reason for those marks. I tried to sleep in the shower the second night, and on the third one I left, and found another (expensive) hotel...but I am never been so happy to spend my money!!!DON'T GO DON'T GO DON'T GO.

Reviews.Title: “Fled after a night”
Reviews.Author: hitchhiker72
Reviews.Content: Pokey room. Icky too. Hard to describe, but I don't think I can add anything to what's already been said. It was cold and miserable to get out of bed to go to the toilet (outside the room) even though it was just next door. Booked it because it was cheap and located in a nice area, but the interior definitely doesn't do it any justice. I don't expect luxury for the price. But surely the carpets and bedding could be cleaned? I fled after a night and bunked in with a friend. She was an overseas student and didn't have much space, but I slept very well on her floor with a sleeping bag!

Reviews.Title: “blrgh!!!!! HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: the_true_review
Reviews.Content: The hotel was covered in a thick layer of dust and it smelled of walnuts on first entry. I believe that the bed sheets were in fact dust sheets previoulsy used in redecorating- they had paint on them. Additional blankets wre itchy. The television was tuned to the wrong channels and needed to be banged every ten minutes or so to make it work. The fridge did not work. The bathroom was grubby and you could here the next rooms bathroom through the wall. The breakfast was a small fry up with a plate of beans, doughnuts and muffins and brownies. Access to kitchen at first sounded like a good idea but the dirt was off putting. About a ten minute walk from Gloucester Tube station, a nice area shame about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: diana12345
Reviews.Content: Ugly,Old,Durty ! The owner is not the nicest guy I met in my life,don't complain to him about the state of your room and the "bathroom",it's risky!!

HotelInfo.Name: Saint Simeon
HotelInfo.Address: 38 Harrington Gardens | South Kensington, London SW7 4LT, England
